title: Easy Shrimp Fried Rice Recipe
description: Homemade shrimp fried rice is easy to make in one pan and ready in under 30 minutes for a takeaway favorite that's sure to please the whole family!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Rice Fried Rice Recipes Easy Shrimp Fried Rice 4.8 (75) 65 Reviews 14 Photos Easy homemade shrimp fried rice with peas, carrots, garlic, and green onions. All my kids love this dish! Submitted by MonkeyMama Updated on February 27, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 14 14 14 14 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Make restaurant-worthy shrimp fried rice with this top-rated recipe.  Shrimp Fried Rice Ingredients These are the ingredients you’ll need to make this shrimp fried rice recipe:  Oils: This shrimp fried rice recipe starts with a mix of olive oil and sesame oil.Shrimp: A pound of peeled and deveined shrimp should be enough to make four servings. Frozen vegetables: Frozen peas, frozen carrots, and frozen corn add color and nutrients.Garlic: Take the flavor up a notch with two cloves of garlic (or more, to taste). Eggs: You’ll need three lightly beaten eggs for this shrimp fried rice recipe. Rice: This quick dinner is a great use for leftover rice. Green onions: Thinly sliced green onions lend a pop of bold color and flavor. Soy sauce: Low-sodium soy sauce is essential for flavorful fried rice. Seasonings: Season this shrimp fried rice recipe with salt and pepper before serving.  How to Make Shrimp Fried Rice You’ll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade shrimp fried rice:  Cook the shrimp in oil, then remove from the pan and set aside. Add the frozen vegetables to the skillet and cook until they begin to soften. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, then push the veggies to one side of the skillet.Scramble the eggs on the other side.Stir the shrimp, rice, and green onions into the skillet. Stir in the soy sauce and seasonings, then cook until the shrimp is reheated. Recipe Tips Cooking time will vary based on size of shrimp.Have all the ingredients prepped before you start cooking, as this recipe moves quickly! Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “Awesome recipe,” says Southern Cooking Queen. “Quick and simple. First time cooking the scrambled eggs with sesame oil!! Gave the recipe a great flavor.” “This was awesome,” according to vallygirl. “I followed the recipe exactly except I didn't have corn, so added more peas and carrots. Very easy as long as you have all the ingredients prepped before you start cooking. This one is a keeper.” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons sesame oil 2 tablespoons olive oil 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined 1 cup frozen peas and carrots ½ cup frozen corn 2 cloves garlic, finely minced, or more to taste 3 large eggs, lightly beaten 4 cups cooked rice 3 tablespoons thinly sliced green onions 3 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce, or more to taste ½ teaspoon salt, or to taste ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste Directions Heat sesame oil and olive oil in a large nonstick skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, about 3 minutes, flipping halfway through. Remove shrimp from the skillet using a slotted spoon, allowing oils and cooking juices to remain in the skillet. Place shrimp on a plate and set aside. Add peas and carrots and corn to the skillet and cook, stirring intermittently, until vegetables begin to soften, about 2 minutes. Add garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute. Push vegetables to the side of the skillet, pour eggs into the other side, and cook to scramble, stirring as necessary, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir shrimp, rice, and green onions into the skillet. Drizzle evenly with soy sauce, season with salt and pepper, and stir to combine. Cook until shrimp is reheated through, about 2 minutes. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Shrimp Fried Rice 01 of 14 Photo by  fabeveryday 02 of 14 Photo by  Elena De' La Rosa 12/17/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort I made your recipe! Waayyy to much rice but I made the 4cups...will have to figure what to do with the rest 😁,but it came out delicious,very easy to follow. THANK YOU 03 of 14 Photo by  PlushWater3844 02/29/2024 Easy and tasty!! 04 of 14 Photo by  fabeveryday 02/22/2024 This is a keeper! I love that the shrimp is added at the end, because it allowed me to separate a bowl for one of my kids who doesn’t like seafood, and everyone loved it. Very yummy and a great ratio of vegetables, rice, and shrimp. 05 of 14 Photo by  CopperBran3392 09/17/2023 06 of 14 Photo by  LaTonya Smith 09/09/2023 I made it and it is delicious 07 of 14 Photo by  Southern Cooking Queen 04/09/2023 Awesome recipe! Quick and simple. First time cooking the scrambled eggs with sesame oil!! Gave the recipe a great flavor. 08 of 14 Photo by  Torry Tolbert Thomas 03/31/2023 Quick, fast, easy, & delicious. Just add a spoon to eat it with so I wouldn't miss anything 😋 09 of 14 Photo by  oalphacash 03/22/2023 The Recipe was really good and fast and easy something that you can whip up real fast. I will definitely be using this recipe again 10 of 14 Photo by  KindScale4801 01/18/2023 Want to get your kids to eat the whole thing? Add a half can or 8 oz of pineapple tidbits. This simple fried rice recipe is easy to build upon. I make this when I need to use up leftover rice, veggies, or chicken breast from the fridge. Separating each set of ingredients as you cook is best. I add Tajin citrus pepper after cooking rather than black pepper during. I sometimes add sautéed chopped cabbage with a white onion. In lieu of sesame oil, I’ll dump a teaspoon of sesame seeds in with the shrimp. I often pour a few ounces of hot water on top of the rice as I mix to prevent sticking.Pictured with hoisin sauce and Yum Yum sauce. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Chicken and Veggie Fried Rice Chicken Fried Rice 2,083 Ratings Pork Fried Rice 338 Ratings Bacon and Chicken Fried Rice 29 Ratings Thai Beef Fried Rice 8 Ratings Hibachi-Style Fried Rice 217 Ratings Egg Fried Rice 46 Ratings Easy Egg Fried Rice 232 Ratings Easy Pineapple Fried Rice 4 Ratings Thai Shrimp Fried Rice (Kao Pad Goong) Pineapple Fried Rice with Ham 11 Ratings Korean Saewoo Bokkeumbap (Shrimp Fried Rice) 38 Ratings Pineapple Shrimp Fried Rice 12 Ratings Shrimp Fried Rice I 61 Ratings Protein-Packed Vegetarian Fried Rice 11 Ratings Kimchi Fried Rice 31 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
